So, I've owned a few Galaxy phones over the years (S2, S4, S6, two S8's and now the S20 FE) so the title 'fan edition' suits me pretty well. It's been good to experience how the Galaxy S range has evolved over time, with noticeable advances in technology and innovation for the better. The first thing that impressed me with the S20 FE is the screen. It's simply a joy to view things on, whether it's video, pictures or simple checking your emails, the screen is just so sharp and responsive, and it's probably the best I've seen on a phone. The sound too is very impressive, with the extra speaker at the top to give the sound the extra kick it needs to be heard. But the thing that drew me to it was the design, with the the mix of metal chasis and 'glastic' back in a good selection of colours, it made its self stand out amongst the ever growing number of generic looking  phones. all in all this is a great phone to have with impressive specs and a killer design.

So, I have had my Samsung S20 FE (Fan Edition, Yay!) for about a month and feel I can now share some of my thoughts on it though I would point out that my experiences so far have been that this is a brilliant phone (saves you having to read the rest). I have the 256Gb version in Cloud Mint colour and bought a transparent Tech21 case to protect it. Looks really great, feels good in hand and the case allows me to see the fantastic colour of the phone. In fact, I like all the colours in this range based on what I have seen on the net.

The 256Gb storage is overkill especially as I also added a 128Gb SD card from my old phone. Imagine, 384Gb of offline storage, I guess I should start getting used to cloud services. My previous phone was a 32Gb S7 (before that an S4, S2 and S1) and I spent ages trying to create space by deleting apps and moving them back onto the SD card, for some reason they never wanted to stay there. With all this space I can now reload all my old favourite apps and games again such as Where's my Water, Temple Run, Asphalt and even some news sites that were simply too big for my old phone. I have installed loads of apps recently and only used 50Gb, so the 128Gb version am sure would be fine for most users. 

As you can tell I have the DS (Dual Sim) version which means I can have two sims (one for this country and one for abroad if needed) or as I have done I used the second sim slot to hold my 128Gb micro sim card. The phone is really fast, the car racing Game Asphalt plays superbly and casting the phone to my TV (via Firestick) was easy and with spectacular results.

I had a lot of indecision whether to get this phone or a pricier, premium version like the S20, S20+, S20 Ultra as each has certain extras (or wait for the S21 FE etc.). I ruled out needing a 108Mp camera, why would I need that. Ultimately the bigger FE battery helped me choose and I easily get a day out of it even though I leave the 120Hz refresh on. Talking of the screen, it's superb whether at 60 or 120Hz. The colours are bright, the blacks are deep and it has a super glossy (premium) look to it. I wouldn’t bother with any more resolution, just overkill.

My old S7 Edge had a curved screen. I don't miss it so don't be put off that the FE is flat, unless that's what you want. Once it’s in its case the shape of the screen is less obvious anyway. I don't need to pay premium prices for that. BTW, the phone arrives with a screen protector and the display size which originally I thought might be too big is just right though I do have larger hands than most. Trust me you will enjoy this display.

Another key factor for me was price and avoiding paying a premium. Although the back is plastic it  looks and feels premium to me. Don't let having glass all-round hold you back as you will be more than satisfied esp. once nestled in its case. 

So the camera is another area where compromise has happened but again, I think the camera is superb. I like to point and shoot and expect a good quality image to appear...it does! There are even three zoom buttons from wide to narrow that are easily accessible on the main camera screen. In fact there is a heap of functionality that I haven’t even begun to dig into in the camera.

While I think of it:
•	Charging: real quick with the supplied USB-C lead and adaptor. Buy yourself a nice new powerful wireless charger and a set of ear buds (I use ENACFIRE E60s) as this phone doesn’t have an audio jack socket. Worried me for a few seconds not having a jack but my earbuds are superb and comfortable lying in bed with my head on the pillow and I barely notice them
•	I had to buy some more leads as I only had the classic micro USB connector (for my S7 and previous phones) where the latest Android phones now use USB-C
•	Sound out is fine
•	The finger print scanner works a treat, absolutely no issues when I use it. Got both my thumbs scanned easily
•	The only downside with this phone and indeed any Samsung past the S10 is that my Gear VR won’t work with it so have had to hang on to my S7 just for that (not trading in).

So all in all after lots of research I am incredibly happy with my Samsung S20 FE 256Gb SM-G781B/DS, I cannot say there are any downsides of significance.. If you are looking for a great phone with all the major functionality then you cannot go wrong with this one, why pay more!

This was an upgrade from a Galaxy S6 that lasted me 5 years and boy was it worth it! The student offer was too good to miss out on.
256GB is more than enough for someone who survived with 32GB for the past 5 years.
Setup was super quick and easy with Smart Switch. It even transferred my wallpaper!
Having a 120hz screen refresh rate is insane and possibly my favourite thing about the phone is how quick and smooth it is. 
The cameras are great. Except for 30x zoom which is pretty much useless. Selfie camera is pretty sharp.
Everything seems really well integrated with some great new features like screen recording and link to Windows. There was a little bit of bloatware but not as much as previous Samsung phones.
I opted for the Snapdragon chip 5G version as I hadn't heard great things about the Exynos chip and everything seems to be working as it should. Except for PS Remote Play, which never seems to link easily. This was a problem with my S6 too.
The battery life is more than enough for a day's worth of fairly heavy use at times with 120hz screen.
No phone heating issues either other than when first booted up, when it got a little warm but that's to be expected.
The screen obviously isnt as bright compared to other flagships since this is the FE edition but it's good enough for me.
The only downside was that the phone arrived in a damaged parcel box and did appear to have some marks on the screen but that may have been from the pre applied screen protector? Since the security seal on the box was still intact and the phone runs fine, I don't believe the phone was tampered with but maybe Samsung should look at quality control and definitely change delivery partners as DPD are an awful company.
Do miss the headphone jack though and it seems only the official Samsung type C to 3.5mm wire works as I did try a OnePlus wire but it didn't work.
Also as a woman with small hands, I did wonder whether the phone would be too big or heavy for me. It's big there's no denying. But not as heavy as my brother's OnePlus 7 Pro. I think maybe the smaller size and lighter weight of the S20 would have been better but I can live with the FE phone's size and weight. Ultimately, the Snapdragon chip was more important to me than size and weight.

However this is all let down by the phone having very poor battery life. The phone can feel warm to the touch after little use and it usually needs to be plugged in around 6pm which isn't at all ideal. Reviews of the 5g version state it has excellent battery life but as the 4g version of the phone has a different processor you will find this device to have a lot worse battery performance which is very misleading from Samsung.

Overall, I would not recommend this device as not having all day battery life is a big loss and I'm definitely thinking of returning it.

Been a long time since my last Samsung phone which says a s2 which with in weeks got screen burn so I've stayed away from amoled screened phone's.

But finally decided to get one as it seems most mid to high end phone use a oled screen these days. 

And so far I'm impressed with s20 fe things I love the most are, the screen 120hz is so nice makes everything so smooth and along with the snapdragon 865 everything is also so snappy, and I'm not fan of curved screens so finding a highish end phone with flat screen is a bonus, no expensive screen protector needed. 

Battery life as been excellent get about 4-5 hours hmm on time with about 40-60% battery remaining to can't complain. 

Is also nice that you can uninstall most of the boat ware that you won't use which is move. 

Camera is also excellent especially the night mode don't know how it does it but you would think it was daylight and not just a street light or the light from the TV. 

And its the first phone well smart/android phone that doesn't get hot it to the touch it get warm at the worst and that's with a case on. 

Overall the best phone I've ever owned can't fault it well apart from the touch issues but only when using the screen touch test app not really noticed it in day to day use but I'm sure Samsung will fix this in a update.

Amazing phone. The 120hz display is very smooth and brings out nice vivid colours. Scrolling down in apps is very satisfying. With the 4,500MAh battery and screen at FHD+ at 120Hz, battery life is amazing with an average of 6 hours of screen on time. 15W charging has been great with the phone also capable of 25W charging meaning charging on the go isn't a problem. 

With the 3 cameras, the photo quality are crystal clear for normal, zoom and ultra wide shots. Video recording available at 4k with an option for live focus video makes video experience even better. The front facing camera takes some nice shots but sometimes skin tones are slightly off depending on lighting. 

The Qualcomm Snapdragon 865 processor seemlessly enables you to game, multitask and take quality photos. With 128GB of storage, there is plenty of space for games, apps, documents and photos and videos. 

Overall, this phone is great for the price. With 5G and Snapdragon 865 (UK) this phone is probably one of the best in the S20 line up when it comes to processing power compared to the Exynos varients of the S20 series. Although the glass used is Gorilla glass 3, you can easily get screen protectors which fit on nicely and also enables the use of the optical fingerprint reader.
This has got to be one of the best Samsung devices I've had in years.... That's due to the snapdragon chip. Would not go back to exynos now

Having had Samsung most of the time and upgrading to the latest model I thought I would be happy changing from my S8 to the S20 FE. Ohh boy am I wrong. The S20 FE looks good but thats about it... Compared to the S8, I don't even know I get notifications as dont have a flashy led light. The finger print scanner is very bad as doesn't even recognise my finger print compared to the S8 which unlocked it perfectly. Software is a little flawed as when turning from landscape to portrait it doesn't do it at times. Writing this review and the phone seems to freeze at times. The phone has no headphone port so always on BT headset which I don't mind wich takes me to the good points. The good points to the phone are that the battery life is very good and the camera is an improvement. But overall, I wouldn't  recommend this phone. I'd say spend the little extra money and go for the S20 or S20 Ultra.
